head.citation-title: Theoretical investigation of 2-(iminomethyl)phenol in the gas phase as a prototype of ultrafast excited-state intramolecular proton transfer
head.abstracts: © 2016 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.Photophysical properties of the smallest o-hydroxy Schiff base, 2-(iminomethyl)phenol (IMP), were elucidated using B3LYP and RI-ADC(2) methods. Cis-enol is the most stable conformation in ground state. Potential energy profiles show that enol-keto tautomerization occurs with a small barrier. However, isomerization from cis- to trans-keto is not possible because of a high barrier. The trans-keto tautomer is only accessible through a conical intersection (CI) after excited-state intramolecular proton transfer (ESIPT). Dynamics results show that cis-enol undergoes ultrafast ESIPT to give cis-keto. Regions of CI may be initiated to yield keto forms through radiativeless process with torsion twist of about 40-50°.

grant-text.$: The authors thank Thailand Research Fund (RSA5880057) for financial support. The authors would like to thank Michael Dommett for proofreading the manuscript. R. D. would like to thank The Science Achievement Scholarship of Thailand (SAST) for Ph.D. fellowship and the Department of Chemistry, Faculty of Science, Chiang Mai University, Chiang Mai, Thailand is also acknowledged.

copyright.$: Copyright 2016 Elsevier B.V., All rights reserved.

coredata.dc:description: Photophysical properties of the smallest o-hydroxy Schiff base, 2-(iminomethyl)phenol (IMP), were elucidated using B3LYP and RI-ADC(2) methods. Cis-enol is the most stable conformation in ground state. Potential energy profiles show that enol-keto tautomerization occurs with a small barrier. However, isomerization from cis- to trans-keto is not possible because of a high barrier. The trans-keto tautomer is only accessible through a conical intersection (CI) after excited-state intramolecular proton transfer (ESIPT). Dynamics results show that cis-enol undergoes ultrafast ESIPT to give cis-keto. Regions of CI may be initiated to yield keto forms through radiativeless process with torsion twist of about 40-50°.
coredata.dc:title: Theoretical investigation of 2-(iminomethyl)phenol in the gas phase as a prototype of ultrafast excited-state intramolecular proton transfer
